channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Republicans got what they wanted
item.description: With no time left on the clock, members of Congress finally reached a deal that would reopen the federal government and raise the debt ceiling.

item.title: NBA, let Jason Collins play
item.description: It was merely a dream, wasn't it?

item.title: Is hand sanitizer toxic?
item.description: You hope that your hand-sanitizer habit is protecting you from colds and flu and gross bugaboos like E. coli. But even if it doesn't, at least it's harmless. Right?

item.title: Officer seen hurling woman into cell
item.description: Erin Burnett talks to Paul Callan about a woman who is suing a police department and accusing it of brutality.

item.title: Ancient creature had spider-like brain
item.description: The ancient world was full of strange animals that have gone extinct, such as a group of marine species with claw-like structures emerging from their heads. A new study suggests that these creatures were related to spiders and scorpions.

item.title: Woman's plane meltdown goes viral
item.description: HLN's Mike Galanos and Dr. Tiffanie Henry discuss what you should do if you encounter a similar situation on a plane.

item.title: Obama: Americans are 'fed up'
item.description: The way business is done in Washington has to change, the president says.

item.title: Why is Ted Cruz smiling?
item.description: The government is open. The debt limit is lifted. The fight is over. But in every fight, there are winners and losers, and this fight is no exception.

item.title: Is Cruz the male Sarah Palin?
item.description: `Conservative political commentator Ann Coulter talks to Piers Morgan about Sen. Ted Cruz and the Republican Party.

item.title: 9 things we missed
item.description: Millions of Americans are none too happy with the federal government right now. The shutdown is over after 16 days, but the things we missed while the government was closed are still fresh in our minds. Here are nine things we're thrilled to have back. Add your own in the comments below!

item.title: D.A.: Dad killed to be with nanny
item.description: At least one of Dr. Martin MacNeill's daughters could testify against him. MacNeill is accused of killing his wife.

item.title: School cafeteria sex act alleged
item.description: Two teenage high school students in Georgia face misdemeanor public indecency charges after an oral sex act allegedly was performed during lunch in the school cafeteria, a school official told CNN.

item.title: Teen rape case may reopen
item.description: A Missouri prosecutor who dropped a rape case will ask the court to appoint a special prosecutor to conduct an independent review of the case and look at possibly refiling charges, Nodaway County Prosecuting Attorney Robert L. Rice said Wednesday.

item.title: Official fired for piggyback ride
item.description: A local Chinese official was fired after a photo of him receiving a piggyback ride while in a flooded town went viral.

item.title: 'Law & Order' star leaving show
item.description: After 21 years of arrests with a side of wisecracks, Detective John Munch will retire Wednesday night on "Law and Order: SVU."

item.title: Conan meets girl football phenom
item.description: 10 year-old football phenom Samantha Gordon tells Conan how she started playing football by accident.

item.title: 'Walking Dead' star has weird ...
item.description: Steven Yeun tell Conan he dreads his "Walking Dead" love scenes because of his shameful itsy-bitsy areolas.

item.title: School bus hijacked in Arkansas
item.description: A man with a knife hijacked a school bus in central Arkansas Thursday morning, taking 11 elementary school students on a wild detour that police ended after a roughly 10-mile chase, authorities said.

item.title: Bus chased by police cars up street
item.description: A man hijacked a school bus in Arkansas, taking 11 students and their driver on a 10-mile chase with police.

item.title: 'Transformers' director assaulted
item.description: Michael Bay apparently was the victim of a violent shakedown by men demanding money on a Hong Kong street Thursday, police said.

item.title: See video of bizarre outburst
item.description: Hear a stenographer ranting during the vote to reopen the federal government on the House floor.

item.title: 2 murderers mistakenly freed
item.description: The state of Florida is asking for help in locating two former prison inmates that they realized should still be current inmates.

item.title: Dad says he is accused bully's alibi
item.description: How much bullying does it take to drive a 12-year-old to suicide? A father defends a girl accused of bullying Rebecca Sedwick, 12, a Florida girl who killed herself.

item.title: Mom: My daughter is not that type
item.description: A 14-year-old accused bully is currently in police custody. Her parents agreed to publicly speak exclusively to New Day.

item.title: Huge meteorite pulled from Russian lake
item.description: Eight months after a meteor blast rained meteorites down on Russia's Chelyabinsk region, what is thought to be the biggest chunk of the space rock yet has been hauled from the depths of a lake, Russian state media said.

item.title: Meteorite chunk hauled up
item.description: CNN's Isha Sesay reports scientists have pulled a huge meteorite from the bottom of a Russian lake.

item.title: Abominable Snowman mystery solved?
item.description: Research by a leading UK geneticist may have unlocked the truth about the Yeti, or Abominable Snowman -- after hair samples from two mystery animals proved to be a genetic match to an ancient polar bear.

item.title: Missouri rape case: DA will ask for a special prosecutor.
item.description: A DA will ask a court to appoint a special prosecutor.

item.title: Ellsberg: He's a hero
item.description: Daniel Ellsberg tells CNN's Don Lemon that NSA leaker Edward Snowden showed courage, has done an enormous service.

item.title: A face you know: Character actor dead
item.description: A face you know is gone.

item.title: 'Unconscious' GI's salute goes viral
item.description: While Army Ranger Josh Hargis was receiving his Purple Heart, he surprised everyone in his hospital room.

item.title: Navarrette: Fit mom brings out bullies
item.description: Ruben Navarrette says the critics of a fit mother who sets a good example for her children are the ones guilty of bullying.

item.title: School bus beating caught on camera
item.description: Two Pennsylvania teens are charged with assault after video of them abusing a peer on a bus goes viral.

item.title: The world's best city is ...
item.description: How many have you been to? And do you agree with the rankings?

item.title: 'Eden': Story of a sex slave in the U.S.
item.description: The film "Eden" is based on Chong Kim's story as a sex slave in the middle of the United States.

item.title: Horrified neighbors see this, call 911
item.description: Kyra Phillips interviews a man whose Halloween decorations were a bit too scary.

item.title: Thanking vets with more than a drink
item.description: It was supposed to be a routine patrol for Dale Beatty, a National Guardsman serving in northern Iraq.

item.title: Diners eat on, from toilets at cafe
item.description: At Magic Restroom Cafe in Los Angeles, guests sit on toilet seats while chomping down on food served in toilet bowls.

item.title: Disney's scariest villains
Straight guy's bag comes out like this
item.description: Imagine arriving at baggage claim and finding "I am gay" written on your luggage. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

item.title: New Kenya attack video
item.description: As they strolled through Westgate Mall, the gunmen chatted on cell phones while firing at terrified shoppers. One of the killers is seen kneeling to pray.

item.title: Terror caught on camera

item.description: "Teen Spirit" and "Good Times" may be coming to the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame -- sealed with a KISS.

item.title: Oarfish
item.description: A marine science instructor's late-afternoon snorkel off the Southern California coast last Sunday was first met with shock and soon excitement when she discovered a gigantic oarfish, a deep-sea creature that remains little known to the science world and people outside.
